metadata.notes: Structured timeline for Tesla HW generations, software milestones, and regulatory actions.

hardware_generations.notes: First Autopilot hardware. Single forward camera + radar + USS. Partnership with Mobileye ended 2016.
8 cameras, radar, USS. Used Nvidia silicon. HW2.5 added discrete GPU. Free retrofit to HW3 for FSD purchasers.

First Tesla-designed silicon. Dual redundant SoC. Same physical size as HW2.5 board, enabling drop-in retrofit. Retrofit cost: free for FSD purchasers, $1000 for others. FSD software capped at v12.6.x.

20 CPU cores per side. Front cameras reduced from 3 to 2 (higher res). B-pillar cameras with heater element. 12 camera connectors on board (3 spare). Phoenix HD radar present in some S/X but not software-enabled. USS fully removed. No retrofit from HW3 (different form factor, wiring, cooling). Musk reversed no-retrofit stance in Q4 2024, promising free upgrade for FSD purchasers, but no retrofits have begun as of Feb 2026.

Half-reticle die size. No legacy GPU or ISP — entire chip is AI inference engine. Softmax in hardware (was emulated in software on AI4). Dual-sourced: TSMC N3P (Arizona Fab 21 Phase 2) + Samsung 4nm (Taylor TX). Samsung EUV trials starting March 2026. Design 'finished' July 2025 per Musk, 'almost done' Jan 2026 (contradiction). Last chip intended for vehicles (AI6 is Optimus/datacenter only). May trigger US export controls for international sales. No retrofit from HW4 possible (different cooling/power requirements per Q2 2025 earnings). Cybercab will ship with AI4 because AI5 not ready in volume.
NOT for vehicles. Optimus robots + data centers. Unified training + inference. $16.5B Samsung deal announced July 2025. Contract through Dec 2033.

software_milestones.significance: First city-street capable autonomous driving beta to non-employees
Major architecture shift: ~300K lines of C++ planning code replaced by E2E neural net
First broad E2E rollout; Autopark added; improved driving visualization
Cabin camera becomes primary attention monitor; steering wheel nag reduced
HW4-first: E2E for highway driving. Actually Smart Summon added. Musk claimed 100x improvement.
First version trained on native 5MP camera data instead of downscaled HW3 resolution
First version using native 5MP resolution. 3x context length. Audio inputs. HW3 forked to v12.6.x permanently.
Emergency vehicle sound detection. Unified highway/city stack for HW3.
10x larger neural network. Navigation integrated into NN. Fewer false braking. Pothole avoidance. MotorTrend Best Tech 2026.
New vehicles ship with only TACC as standard. FSD renamed 'Full Self-Driving (Supervised)'. Subscription-only after Feb 14, 2026.
Latest: upgraded vision encoder. David Moss achieved 12,961 miles intervention-free on v14.2.1.25.

regulatory_actions.action: PE 22-002: Investigation into phantom braking (416K vehicles)
Recall 22V-120: Rolling stop functionality in FSD Beta (54K vehicles)
EA 22-002: Upgraded investigation into emergency vehicle crashes (830K vehicles)
Recall 23V-085: FSD Beta running red lights, disobeying speed limits (363K vehicles)
Recall 23V-838: Autopilot misuse — insufficient driver engagement controls (2.03M vehicles)
regulatory_actions.impact: OTA: larger alerts, stricter monitoring, 1-week lockout after 5 forced disengagements

regulatory_actions.action: RQ24009: Recall Query on 23V-838 remedy effectiveness
regulatory_actions.impact: Post-remedy crashes continued; remedy partly opt-in and reversible

regulatory_actions.action: FSD low-visibility probe (2.4M vehicles): 4 collisions in fog/sun glare including fatal pedestrian strike
Actually Smart Summon probe (2.6M vehicles): 16 crash reports
regulatory_actions.impact: Tesla failed to report crashes per Standing General Order

regulatory_actions.action: Crash-reporting violations probe: Tesla reported crashes months late
PE25012: FSD traffic violations (2.88M vehicles) — running red lights (6 crash-causing, 4 with injuries), crossing double-yellow, wrong-way turns
regulatory_actions.status: Open — escalating. 80 violation reports by Dec 2025. NHTSA demanded review of 8,313 potential violations. Deadline extended to Feb 23, 2026.
regulatory_actions.impact: Could lead to formal recall or deployment restrictions

regulatory_actions.action: ALJ hearing on deceptive Autopilot/FSD marketing (filed 2022, hearing July 2025)
regulatory_actions.impact: Tesla given 60 days to fix marketing or face 30-day sales suspension in CA

regulatory_actions.action: Class action certified: FSD purchasers alleging Tesla promised autonomy never delivered
Criminal investigation: subpoenas re whether Tesla misled customers about FSD/Autopilot
Safeguard ratings launched: Tesla Autopilot and FSD both rated POOR
Transportation Secretary announces policy to ease AV safety rules and crash reporting
regulatory_actions.impact: Favorable to Tesla: deployment cap increase proposed (2,500 → 100,000+), national framework to preempt state regs

naming_reconciliation.resolution: AI5 = HW5. Tesla officially renamed the 'HW' prefix to 'AI' at the June 13, 2024 Annual Shareholder Meeting. HW3=AI3, HW4=AI4, HW5=AI5. The 'A15' naming in the original plan was a user error — the correct designation is 'AI5'. There is no separate chip called 'A15'.
naming_reconciliation.vehicle_vs_datacenter: AI5 is the last chip intended for vehicles (and Optimus robots). AI6 is exclusively for Optimus + data centers. Dojo (D1 chip) was a separate training-only chip family that was shut down Aug 2025 and restarted Jan 2026 using AI5 silicon.
